title: Leonardo DiCaprio endorses Kamala Harris: 'We need a bold step forward ...'
'Disgusting': Trump campaign slams Hillary Clinton for 'reenacting Nazi rally' attack
Chinese hackers targeted Trump, JD Vance's phones: Report
content: "The type of information on phones used by a presidential candidate and his running mate could be a gold mine for an intelligence agency: Who they called and texted, how often they communicated with certain people, and how long they talked to those people could be highly valuable to an adversary like China. That sort of communications data could be even more useful if hackers could observe it in real time," the NYT report said.
summary: "The type of information on phones used by a presidential candidate and his running mate could be a gold mine for an intelligence agency: Who they called and texted, how often they communicated with certain people, and how long they talked to those people could be highly valuable to an adversary like China. That sort of communications data could be even more useful if hackers could observe it in real time," the NYT report said.

title: Whatever Barron recommended broke the internet, says Trump campaign adviser on podcast choice
content: ​“I got to tell you, hats off to the young man (Barron Trump). Every single recommendation he’s had has turned out to be absolute ratings gold that’s broke the internet," Jason Miller said as Trump is all set to appear with Joe Rogan's podcast to be recorded today. Rogan's podcast is one of the most popular in the US with 14 million followers on the streaming platform Spotify. This will be Donald Trump's first appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast.
summary: ​“I got to tell you, hats off to the young man (Barron Trump). Every single recommendation he’s had has turned out to be absolute ratings gold that’s broke the internet," Jason Miller said as Trump is all set to appear with Joe Rogan's podcast to be recorded today. Rogan's podcast is one of the most popular in the US with 14 million followers on the streaming platform Spotify. This will be Donald Trump's first appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast.

title: 'What the f**k to do with them?': Russian soldiers hostile to arriving North Korean soldiers, intercepts show
content: Russian soldiers are apprehensive about the arrival of North Korean troops, criticizing the command structure and support logistics. Ukraine's Defense Intelligence intercepted communications revealing these concerns. North Korean troops have been spotted in Russia's Kursk region, and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned this escalation, urging international pressure against Moscow and Pyongyang.
summary: Russian soldiers are apprehensive about the arrival of North Korean troops, criticizing the command structure and support logistics. Ukraine's Defense Intelligence intercepted communications revealing these concerns. North Korean troops have been spotted in Russia's Kursk region, and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned this escalation, urging international pressure against Moscow and Pyongyang.

title: Washington Post won't endorse Trump or Harris this election -- first time in 36 years
content: ​Earlier it was reported that the paper was dragging its feet on the decision as owner Jeff Bezos is not willing to endorse Kamala Harris alienating Donald Trump. The decision to not endorse anyone confirms the dithering. A New York Post report earlier said that the editorial board of the Washington Post wrote its endorsement of Kamala Harris but received no approval from Bezos or Will Lewis to publish it.
summary: ​Earlier it was reported that the paper was dragging its feet on the decision as owner Jeff Bezos is not willing to endorse Kamala Harris alienating Donald Trump. The decision to not endorse anyone confirms the dithering. A New York Post report earlier said that the editorial board of the Washington Post wrote its endorsement of Kamala Harris but received no approval from Bezos or Will Lewis to publish it.

title: Watch: Donald Trump adds golf swing to his iconic dance moves, social media reacts
content: Former US President Donald Trump added a golf swing to his signature dance moves at a rally, sparking online reactions. Despite Village People's earlier objections to Trump's usage of their song "YMCA," frontman Victor Willis has decided to permit its use until the 2024 campaign's end.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump added a golf swing to his signature dance moves at a rally, sparking online reactions. Despite Village People's earlier objections to Trump's usage of their song "YMCA," frontman Victor Willis has decided to permit its use until the 2024 campaign's end.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy reveals Trump's rare human trait, says 'couldn't be more impressed'
content: JD Vance said Donald Trump's energy level is off the charts and it's crazy how little Donald Trump sleeps. "I sleep less than most people. Not saying it's good or bad, just the way I'm constituted. Trump sleeps less than I do, does as many (or more) events, and will still randomly call me to check on my family. It's the craziest thing," Vance said.
summary: JD Vance said Donald Trump's energy level is off the charts and it's crazy how little Donald Trump sleeps. "I sleep less than most people. Not saying it's good or bad, just the way I'm constituted. Trump sleeps less than I do, does as many (or more) events, and will still randomly call me to check on my family. It's the craziest thing," Vance said.

title: Ukraine's bid to add Russia to FATF's 'black list' fails as India, China reject move
content: Ukraine's bid to blacklist Russia over high-risk money laundering was rejected by India, China, Saudi Arabia, and South Africa during the FATF discussions in Paris. Brazil also opposed the proposal, which led to a delay for further evidence gathering. Russia's FATF membership remains suspended.
summary: Ukraine's bid to blacklist Russia over high-risk money laundering was rejected by India, China, Saudi Arabia, and South Africa during the FATF discussions in Paris. Brazil also opposed the proposal, which led to a delay for further evidence gathering. Russia's FATF membership remains suspended.

title: Trump's Joe Rogan interview today: Time, past controversies - what we know
content: Joe Rogan Podcast: Donald Trump is set to record an interview with Joe Rogan in Austin today though the episode's release date is unknown. Joe Rogan in 2022 called Donald Trump a threat to democracy, endorsed RFK Jr's candidacy for the presidential race over Donald Trump when Kennedy Jr was still an independent candidate, and also praised Kamala Harris' debate performance.
summary: Joe Rogan Podcast: Donald Trump is set to record an interview with Joe Rogan in Austin today though the episode's release date is unknown. Joe Rogan in 2022 called Donald Trump a threat to democracy, endorsed RFK Jr's candidacy for the presidential race over Donald Trump when Kennedy Jr was still an independent candidate, and also praised Kamala Harris' debate performance.

title: JD Vance says many of his friends won't vote for him; 'That doesn't...'
content: "Whether you vote for me, whether you vote for Donald Trump, whether you vote for Kamala Harris…don't cast aside family members and lifelong friendships. Politics is not worth it. And I think we follow that principle, we will heal the divide in this country," JD Vance said speaking at the News Nation Town Hall.
summary: "Whether you vote for me, whether you vote for Donald Trump, whether you vote for Kamala Harris…don't cast aside family members and lifelong friendships. Politics is not worth it. And I think we follow that principle, we will heal the divide in this country," JD Vance said speaking at the News Nation Town Hall.

title: 'Sick s**t': Diddy's star-studded parties were ruse to 'freak offs', claims report
content: The recent lawsuits against Diddy prove that the Hollywood parties that Diddy used to throw after major events turned into orgies later. One famous Diddy party has been mentioned which was an afterparty from the MTV VMAs in 2005. Eva Longoria, Fergie, Ice-T, Quincy Jones, Paris Hilton were all present at the party but new lawsuits mention the same party where one or several have been raped.
summary: The recent lawsuits against Diddy prove that the Hollywood parties that Diddy used to throw after major events turned into orgies later. One famous Diddy party has been mentioned which was an afterparty from the MTV VMAs in 2005. Eva Longoria, Fergie, Ice-T, Quincy Jones, Paris Hilton were all present at the party but new lawsuits mention the same party where one or several have been raped.

title: NYT/Sienna final poll says Kamala Harris, Donald Trump tied at 48 per cent popular vote
content: With 10 days left for the 2024 election, a NYT/Sienna College poll reveals a tie between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump at 48% each. Early voting favors Harris significantly, while Trump gains on immigration issues. The poll found that the 9 per cent of Americans who said they already had voted leaned heavily toward Harris -- 59 per cent to 40 per cent. This is a tradition that Democrats generally win in early voting and mail voting.
summary: With 10 days left for the 2024 election, a NYT/Sienna College poll reveals a tie between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump at 48% each. Early voting favors Harris significantly, while Trump gains on immigration issues. The poll found that the 9 per cent of Americans who said they already had voted leaned heavily toward Harris -- 59 per cent to 40 per cent. This is a tradition that Democrats generally win in early voting and mail voting.

title: Japan to resume trial removal of Fukushima nuclear debris: Reports
content: The operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima nuclear plant will resume an operation to remove a sample of highly radioactive material next week, reports said Friday, after having suspended the effort over a technical snag. TEPCO on Friday said it would resume the removal on Monday after replacing the cameras with new ones, the Asahi Shimbun daily and other local media reported.
summary: The operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima nuclear plant will resume an operation to remove a sample of highly radioactive material next week, reports said Friday, after having suspended the effort over a technical snag. TEPCO on Friday said it would resume the removal on Monday after replacing the cameras with new ones, the Asahi Shimbun daily and other local media reported.

title: Why President Biden said that he would apologise to Native Americans
content: President Joe Biden will deliver a formal apology for the U.S. government's role in the boarding school system that forced Indigenous children from their families and subjected them to abuse. The apology, to be made during a visit to the Gila River Indian Community in Arizona, addresses the long-lasting scars inflicted on generations.
summary: President Joe Biden will deliver a formal apology for the U.S. government's role in the boarding school system that forced Indigenous children from their families and subjected them to abuse. The apology, to be made during a visit to the Gila River Indian Community in Arizona, addresses the long-lasting scars inflicted on generations.

title: From rags to riches: Dean Forbes crowned UK’s most influential Black person
content: Dean Forbes, named the UK’s most influential Black individual, leads Forterro, a €2 billion tech firm. From homelessness to CEO, Forbes leverages his platform to advocate for inclusivity and inspire young Black Britons. He also heads a charitable group that raised over £400,000 this year.
summary: Dean Forbes, named the UK’s most influential Black individual, leads Forterro, a €2 billion tech firm. From homelessness to CEO, Forbes leverages his platform to advocate for inclusivity and inspire young Black Britons. He also heads a charitable group that raised over £400,000 this year.

title: Watch: Nasa's SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns to Earth after 236 days in space
content: NASA's Crew-8 mission has concluded after 236 days in space, as the team successfully splashed down off Pensacola, Florida, in a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. The mission covered 100 million miles and involved eight spacecraft arrivals and departures at the ISS, underscoring ongoing space station operations.
summary: NASA's Crew-8 mission has concluded after 236 days in space, as the team successfully splashed down off Pensacola, Florida, in a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. The mission covered 100 million miles and involved eight spacecraft arrivals and departures at the ISS, underscoring ongoing space station operations.

title: Hurricane Kristy strengthens into a Category 5 storm, expected to weaken over open Pacific waters
content: Hurricane Kristy has intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Pacific, becoming the first such storm without El Niño since 2010. Currently moving westward, Kristy is expected to weaken over the weekend but will generate hazardous surf conditions along Baja California's west coast.
summary: Hurricane Kristy has intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Pacific, becoming the first such storm without El Niño since 2010. Currently moving westward, Kristy is expected to weaken over the weekend but will generate hazardous surf conditions along Baja California's west coast.

title: Who is Kari Lake? Journalist-turned-politician whom Bill Clinton finds ‘physically attractive’
content: Kari Lake, Republican US Senate candidate, responded wittily to Bill Clinton's remark calling her 'physically attractive,' referencing his past controversies. Clinton's comment came during a rally in Phoenix supporting Kamala Harris. Lake, a former TV news anchor, previously ran for Arizona governor and is now eyeing the Senate seat against incumbent Kyrsten Sinema and Democrat Ruben Gallego.
summary: Kari Lake, Republican US Senate candidate, responded wittily to Bill Clinton's remark calling her 'physically attractive,' referencing his past controversies. Clinton's comment came during a rally in Phoenix supporting Kamala Harris. Lake, a former TV news anchor, previously ran for Arizona governor and is now eyeing the Senate seat against incumbent Kyrsten Sinema and Democrat Ruben Gallego.

title: What are the lawsuits against McDonald’s over E. coli outbreak linked to Quarter Pounders?
content: McDonald's is facing lawsuits from two individuals who contracted E. coli linked to slivered onions in their Quarter Pounder burgers. The outbreak has affected 49 people across 10 states, resulting in one death. The company has paused onion distribution and initiated a recall.
summary: McDonald's is facing lawsuits from two individuals who contracted E. coli linked to slivered onions in their Quarter Pounder burgers. The outbreak has affected 49 people across 10 states, resulting in one death. The company has paused onion distribution and initiated a recall.
